name: tightness
content:
tightness noun [U]
(UNCOMFORTABLE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of fitting the body too closely: the tightness of the waistband
an uncomfortable feeling of pressure in the chest, throat, or a muscle: One of the typical symptoms of anxiety is a feeling of tightness in the chest.
the quality of looking or sounding as if you are angry, frightened, or nervous, and not relaxed: There was a strange tightness in her voice.
More examplesFewer examplesOne defendant complained about the tightness of his handcuffs.Her mother would criticize the tightness of her skirt.This exercise relieves lower-back tension and tightness. He had to stop playing because of tightness in his right hamstring.Common asthma symptoms include cough, wheezing, tightness in the chest, and shortness of breath. There was a sudden tightness in his throat and he almost gagged.

tightness noun [U]
(FIRMNESS)
the quality of being held or kept together firmly: Check the tightness of the screw.
the quality of being pulled or stretched firmly: Pegs are used to adjust the tightness of the strings.
More examplesFewer examplesMaintain the tightness of all handles by checking and retightening them regularly.Check cables for tightness. It would be prudent to occasionally check the tightness of that screw. We first tested every nut for tightness and found about 90 percent of the nuts could easily be loosened by fingers alone.Don't let it sag as this will undo the tightness of the roll. These consist of two or three drums in which the degree of tightness of the stretched vibrating skin can be adjusted to give notes of definite pitch.

tightness noun [U]
(OF RACE)
the situation when people in a competition, race, etc. are of a similar standard so it is difficult to know who will win: the tightness of the presidential race
More examplesFewer examplesGiven the tightness of the race and the promise of victory within reach of either party, the result will be a shock to some.He added that the tightness of the contest could lead to lawyers getting involved. The debate was a pivotal moment for both candidates, considering the tightness of the race.

tightness noun [U]
(LACK)
the fact that there is not much of something such as money, space, or time: We are constrained by the tightness of the budget.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's unfortunate that the tightness of budgets forces the department to make decisions that are risky.Given the tightness in the global drilling market, rig prices have more than doubled in recent years. The problem is the tightness of the supply of grain and animal feed throughout the world.Because of the tightness of a construction site in New York City, there's always the problem of having less space.He checks the tightness of a doorway before attempting to move the table through it.
